description: Although strictly speaking the Rutherford scattering cross section is the Coulomb scattering cross section
for two non-identical charged particles (see equation (\ref{eq:6.7})), we also use this markup to
describe the case of identical charged particle Coulomb scattering (see equation (\ref{eq:6.8})).
In either case, the Coulomb scattering cross section is analytic.
RutherfordScattering.name: RutherfordScattering

description: When \element{CoulombPlusNuclearElastic} is used in place of an actual distribution
this link is used to refer back to the parameterisation that defines the distribution.
href.name: href

description: If both outgoing products are the same type of particle, for example
in the reaction `\texttt{p + p -> p + p}'. If true, the angular dependence is
Otherwise, the angular dependence is not symmetric and applies $-1 \le \mu \le \mu_{cutoff}$.
identicalParticles.name: identicalParticles

label.description: Style label for this cross section.
label.name: label

pid.description: The particle identifier of the outgoing particle.
pid.name: pid

productFrame.description: The frame that the product data are defined in.
productFrame.name: productFrame

RutherfordScattering.description: This differential cross section is given by the Rutherford scattering cross section.
RutherfordScattering.name: RutherfordScattering

nuclearAmplitudeExpansion.description: This differential cross section is given by the nuclear amplitude expansion.
nuclearAmplitudeExpansion.name: nuclearAmplitudeExpansion

nuclearPlusInterference.description: This differential cross section is given by the nuclear plus interference approach.
nuclearPlusInterference.name: nuclearPlusInterference

description: This is either a container holding the differential charged particle scattering cross section or a reference to said container.
It may appear inside a \texttt{doubleDifferentialCrossSection}, \texttt{crossSection} or \texttt{distribution} node.
CoulombPlusNuclearElastic.name: CoulombPlusNuclearElastic

muCutoff.description: Cosine of the cutoff angle. Above the cutoff angle, the distribution is assumed to be pure Coulomb scattering.
muCutoff.name: muCutoff

description: It is possible to represent experimental data using the ``nuclear
plus interference'' cross section and angular distribution in the CM
where $\mu_{min}=-1$ for different particles and 0 for
identical particles.  The maximum cosine should be as close to 1.0 as
possible, especially at high energies where Coulomb scattering is less
$\sigma_{c}(\mu ,E)$ is to be computed using equations~(\ref{eq:6.7})
or (\ref{eq:6.8}) for different or identical particles, respectively.
nuclearPlusInterference.name: nuclearPlusInterference

nuclearTerm.description: The coefficients $b_l(E)$ in the nuclear term of equations (\ref{eq:6.11}) or (\ref{eq:6.12})
nuclearTerm.name: nuclearTerm

realInterferenceTerm.description: The coefficients $\texttt{Re}(a_l(E))$ in the interference term of equations (\ref{eq:6.11}) or (\ref{eq:6.12})
realInterferenceTerm.name: realInterferenceTerm

imaginaryInterferenceTerm.description: The coefficients $\texttt{Im}(a_l(E))$ in the interference term of equations (\ref{eq:6.11}) or (\ref{eq:6.12})
imaginaryInterferenceTerm.name: imaginaryInterferenceTerm

description: The net elastic scattering cross section for distinguishable particles may be written as:
\noindent and the cross section for identical particles is:
\noindent where the $a_{l}$ are complex coefficients for expanding the trace of
the nuclear scattering amplitude matrix and the $b_{l}$ are real
coefficients for expanding the nuclear scattering cross section.  The
value of NL represents the highest partial wave contributing to nuclear
The three terms in Equations (\ref{eq:6.11}) and (\ref{eq:6.12}) are
Coulomb, interference, and nuclear scattering, respectively.
nuclearAmplitudeExpansion.name: nuclearAmplitudeExpansion

XYs2d.description: The coefficients $b_l(E)$ given as a Legendre moment expansion inside an \element{XYs2d}
XYs2d.name: XYs2d

regions2d.description: The coefficients $b_l(E)$ given as a Legendre moment expansion inside an \element{regions2d}
regions2d.name: regions2d

nuclearTerm.name: nuclearTerm

XYs2d.name: XYs2d

regions2d.name: regions2d

realInterferenceTerm.description: The coefficients $\texttt{Re}(a_l(E))$ in the interference term of equations (\ref{eq:6.11}) or (\ref{eq:6.12})
realInterferenceTerm.name: realInterferenceTerm

XYs2d.description: The coefficients $\texttt{Im}(a_l(E))$ given as a Legendre moment expansion inside an \element{XYs2d}
XYs2d.name: XYs2d

regions2d.description: The coefficients $\texttt{Im}(a_l(E))$ given as a Legendre moment expansion inside an \element{regions2d}
regions2d.name: regions2d
